title: Fall of the Western Roman Empire
description: The fall of the Western Roman Empire marked the end of ancient Rome and the start of the Middle Ages.

title: Invention of the Printing Press
description: Johannes Gutenberg invents the movable type printing press, revolutionizing the spread of information and learning.

title: American Declaration of Independence
description: The United States declares independence from Britain, marking the birth of a new nation.

title: Edison Invents the Practical Light Bulb
description: Thomas Edison perfects the practical incandescent light bulb, ushering in the age of electric lighting.

title: Discovery of Penicillin
description: Alexander Fleming discovers penicillin, the first widely used antibiotic, revolutionizing medicine.

title: First Human in Space
description: Yuri Gagarin orbits Earth aboard Vostok 1, becoming the first human to travel into space.

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
description: The Berlin Wall falls, symbolizing the end of the Cold War and the division of Germany.

title: Launch of the Large Hadron Collider
description: The Large Hadron Collider begins operation, enabling groundbreaking experiments in particle physics.
